title.en: Biographies of Han Xin (King of Han) and Lu Wan
title.raw: 《韓信盧綰列傳》Biographies of Han Xin (King of Han) and Lu Wan

sentences.zh: 韓王信者，故韓襄王孽孫也，長八尺五寸。

translations.literal: Han King Xin, former Han Xiang King illegitimate grandson, long eight chi five cun.
translations.idiomatic: King Xin of Han was the illegitimate grandson of the former King Xiang of Han. He was eight chi and five cun tall.

sentences.zh: 及項梁之立楚後懷王也，燕、齊、趙、魏皆已前王，唯韓無有後，故立韓諸公子橫陽君成為韓王，欲以撫定韓故地。

translations.literal: When Xiang Liang established Chu's later Huai King, Yan, Qi, Zhao, Wei all already had former kings, only Han had no successor, therefore established Han's various noble sons Lord Hengyang Cheng as Han King, desiring to pacify and settle Han's old lands.
translations.idiomatic: When Xiang Liang established the Later King Huai of Chu, Yan, Qi, Zhao, and Wei all already had former kings. Only Han lacked a successor. Therefore, he established one of Han's noble sons, Lord Hengyang Cheng, as King of Han, hoping to pacify and stabilize Han's traditional territories.

sentences.zh: 項梁敗死定陶，成奔懷王。

translations.literal: Xiang Liang defeated died Dingtao, Cheng fled to Huai King.
translations.idiomatic: Xiang Liang was defeated and died at Dingtao. Cheng fled to King Huai.

sentences.zh: 沛公引兵擊陽城，使張良以韓司徒降下韓故地，得信，以為韓將，將其兵從沛公入武關。

translations.literal: Pei Gong led troops attacked Yangcheng, made Zhang Liang with Han Situ surrender Han old lands, obtained Xin, made him Han general, led his troops followed Pei Gong entered Wuguan.
translations.idiomatic: Pei Gong led troops to attack Yangcheng. He sent Zhang Liang, along with the Han Situ, to accept the surrender of Han's traditional territories. He obtained Xin and made him a Han general. Xin led his troops and followed Pei Gong through Wuguan Pass.

translations.literal: Han Wang Xin, former Han Xiang Wang bastard grandson, long eight chi five cun. Reach Xiang Liang establish Chu after Huai Wang, Yan, Qi, Zhao, Wei all already before wang, only Han no have after, therefore establish Han various gong zi Heng Yang Jun Cheng become Han Wang, desire with pacify settle Han old land. Xiang Liang defeat die Ding Tao, Cheng flee Huai Wang. Pei Gong lead troops strike Yang Cheng, make Zhang Liang with Han si tu descend Han old land, obtain Xin, become Han jiang, lead his troops follow Pei Gong enter Wu Guan.

sentences.zh: 沛公立為漢王，韓信從入漢中，乃說漢王曰：「項王王諸將近地，而王獨遠居此，此左遷也。

translations.literal: Pei Gong established as Han King, Han Xin followed entered Hanzhong, then persuaded Han King said: 'Xiang King kings various generals near lands, yet king alone far dwells here, this demotion.'
translations.idiomatic: After Pei Gong was established as King of Han, Han Xin followed him into Hanzhong. Thereupon he advised the King of Han: 'Xiang Wang has enfeoffed his generals with nearby territories, but Your Majesty alone dwells far away here. This is a demotion.'

sentences.zh: 士卒皆山東人，跂而望歸，及其鋒東鄉，可以爭天下。」

translations.literal: Soldiers all Shandong people, tiptoe yet hope return, reach their vanguard east toward, can contend world.'
translations.idiomatic: The soldiers are all from Shandong. They stand on tiptoe hoping to return home. Once their vanguard turns east, they can contend for the world.'

sentences.zh: 漢王還定三秦，乃許信為韓王，先拜信為韓太尉，將兵略韓地。

translations.literal: Han King returned pacified three Qin, then permitted Xin become Han King, first appointed Xin as Han taiwei, led troops swept Han lands.
translations.idiomatic: The King of Han returned and pacified the three Qin territories. Thereupon he agreed to make Xin King of Han. First, he appointed Xin as Han taiwei and had him lead troops to sweep through Han territories.

translations.literal: Pei Gong establish become Han Wang, Han Xin follow enter Han Zhong, then say Han Wang said: 'Xiang Wang wang various jiang near land, yet wang alone far dwell this, this left move.' Shi zu all Shan Dong person, qi yet hope return, reach its front east xiang, able contend tian xia.' Han Wang return settle three Qin, then allow Xin become Han Wang, first appoint Xin become Han tai wei, lead troops sweep Han land.

sentences.zh: 項籍之封諸王皆就國，韓王成以不從無功，不遣就國，更以為列侯。

translations.literal: Xiang Ji's enfeoffment various kings all went to their states, Han King Cheng because not followed no merit, not sent go to state, changed to liehou.
translations.idiomatic: Xiang Ji enfeoffed the various kings and they all went to their states. Han King Cheng, because he had not followed and had no merit, was not sent to his state. Instead, he was made a liehou.

sentences.zh: 及聞漢遣韓信略韓地，乃令故項籍游吳時吳令鄭昌為韓王以距漢。

translations.literal: When heard Han sent Han Xin swept Han lands, then ordered former Xiang Ji toured Wu time Wu magistrate Zheng Chang become Han King to resist Han.
translations.idiomatic: When he heard that Han had sent Han Xin to sweep through Han territories, he ordered Zheng Chang—former magistrate of Wu during Xiang Ji's tour of Wu—to become King of Han and resist Han.

sentences.zh: 漢二年，韓信略定韓十餘城。

translations.literal: Han second year, Han Xin swept settled Han more than ten cities.
translations.idiomatic: In the second year of Han, Han Xin swept through and pacified more than ten cities in Han.

sentences.zh: 漢王至河南，韓信急擊韓王昌陽城。

translations.literal: Han King reached Henan, Han Xin urgently attacked Han King Chang Yangcheng.
translations.idiomatic: The King of Han reached Henan. Han Xin urgently attacked King Chang of Han at Yangcheng.

sentences.zh: 昌降，漢王乃立韓信為韓王，常將韓兵從。

translations.literal: Chang surrendered, Han King then established Han Xin as Han King, constantly led Han troops followed.
translations.idiomatic: Chang surrendered. The King of Han then established Han Xin as King of Han. Xin constantly led Han troops in the campaigns.

sentences.zh: 三年，漢王出滎陽，韓王信、周苛等守滎陽。

translations.literal: Third year, Han King exited Xingyang, Han King Xin, Zhou Ke etc guarded Xingyang.
translations.idiomatic: In the third year, the King of Han left Xingyang. King Xin of Han, Zhou Ke, and others defended Xingyang.

sentences.zh: 及楚敗滎陽，信降楚，已而得亡，復歸漢，漢復立以為韓王，竟從擊破項籍，天下定。

translations.literal: When Chu defeated Xingyang, Xin surrendered Chu, soon after got escape, again returned Han, Han again established him as Han King, finally followed attacked broke Xiang Ji, world settled.
translations.idiomatic: When Chu defeated them at Xingyang, Xin surrendered to Chu. Soon after, he escaped and returned to Han. Han again established him as King of Han. In the end, he followed in the campaign that broke Xiang Ji and pacified the world.

sentences.zh: 五年春，遂與剖符為韓王，王潁川。

translations.literal: Fifth year spring, then with divided tally became Han King, reigned Yingchuan.
translations.idiomatic: In spring of the fifth year, he was formally enfeoffed with the divided tally as King of Han, reigning over Yingchuan.

translations.literal: Xiang Ji seal various wang all go country, Han Wang Cheng with not follow no merit, not send go country, change become lie hou. Reach hear Han send Han Xin sweep Han land, then make former Xiang Ji you Wu time Wu ling Zheng Chang become Han Wang with resist Han. Han two years, Han Xin sweep settle Han ten remain city. Han Wang reach He Nan, Han Xin urgent strike Han Wang Chang Yang Cheng. Chang descend, Han Wang then establish Han Xin become Han Wang, constant lead Han troops follow. Three years, Han Wang out Xing Yang, Han Wang Xin, Zhou Ke wait guard Xing Yang. Reach Chu defeat Xing Yang, Xin descend Chu, already yet obtain flee, again return Han, Han again establish become Han Wang, finally follow strike break Xiang Ji, tian xia settle. Five years spring, then with carve fu become Han Wang, wang Ying Chuan.

sentences.zh: 明年春，上以韓信材武，所王北近鞏、洛，南迫宛、葉，東有淮陽，皆天下勁兵處，乃詔徙韓王信王太原以北，備御胡，都晉陽。

translations.literal: Next year spring, shang with Han Xin talent martial, place king north near Gong, Luo, south press Wan, Ye, east have Huai Yang, all tian xia strong troops place, then zhao move Han Wang Xin king Tai Yuan with north, prepare yu Hu, capital Jin Yang.
translations.idiomatic: The next spring, considering Han Xin's martial talents, the position he had been enfeoffed with bordered the north near Gong and Luo, pressed south against Wan and Ye, and had Huaiyang to the east—all places with the strongest troops in the world—the emperor issued a decree moving King Xin of Han to reign over Taiyuan and north, to prepare defenses against the Hu, with his capital at Jinyang.

sentences.zh: 信上書曰：「國被邊，匈奴數入，晉陽去塞遠，請治馬邑。」

translations.literal: Xin submitted memorial said: 'Country border edge, Xiong Nu number enter, Jin Yang go frontier far, please govern Ma Yi.'
translations.idiomatic: Xin submitted a memorial saying: 'My kingdom borders the frontier. The Xiongnu frequently invade. Jinyang is far from the frontier. Please allow me to govern from Mayi.'

sentences.zh: 上許之，信乃徙治馬邑。

translations.literal: Shang allowed it, Xin then moved governed Mayi.
translations.idiomatic: The emperor approved. Xin then moved his seat of government to Mayi.

sentences.zh: 秋，匈奴冒頓大圍信，信數使使胡求和解。

translations.literal: Autumn, Xiong Nu Mao Dun big surround Xin, Xin number make shi Hu seek peace dissolve.
translations.idiomatic: In autumn, the Xiongnu under Modun greatly surrounded Xin. Xin repeatedly sent envoys to the Hu seeking peace.

sentences.zh: 漢發兵救之，疑信數閒使，有二心，使人責讓信。

translations.literal: Han send troops save it, suspect Xin number space shi, have two heart, make person blame let Xin.
translations.idiomatic: Han sent troops to rescue him, but suspected that Xin's frequent secret envoys indicated disloyalty. He sent someone to reprimand Xin.

sentences.zh: 信恐誅，因與匈奴約共攻漢，反，以馬邑降胡，擊太原。

translations.literal: Xin fear execute, because with Xiong Nu about together attack Han, rebel, with Ma Yi descend Hu, strike Tai Yuan.
translations.idiomatic: Xin, fearing execution, therefore made an agreement with the Xiongnu to jointly attack Han. He rebelled, surrendered Mayi to the Hu, and attacked Taiyuan.

Xin fear execute, because with Xiong Nu about together attack Han, rebel, with Ma Yi descend Hu, strike Tai Yuan.

sentences.zh: 七年冬，上自往擊，破信軍銅鞮，斬其將王喜。

translations.literal: Seven years winter, shang self go strike, break Xin army Tong Di, cut his jiang Wang Xi.
translations.idiomatic: In winter of the seventh year, the emperor personally went to attack, breaking Xin's army at Tongdi and executing his general Wang Xi.

sentences.zh: 信亡走匈奴。

translations.literal: Xin fled walked Xiong Nu.
translations.idiomatic: Xin fled to the Xiongnu.

sentences.zh: （與）其與白土人曼丘臣、王黃等立趙苗裔趙利為王，復收信敗散兵，而與信及冒頓謀攻漢。

translations.literal: Its with Bai Tu person Man Qiu Chen, Wang Huang wait establish Zhao Miao yi Zhao Li become wang, again collect Xin defeat scatter troops, yet with Xin and Mao Dun plan attack Han.
translations.idiomatic: He and the people of Baitu—Manqiuchen, Wang Huang, and others—established Zhao Li, a descendant of Zhao, as king. They again gathered Xin's defeated and scattered troops, and together with Xin and Modun plotted to attack Han.

sentences.zh: 匈奴仗左右賢王將萬餘騎與王黃等屯廣武以南，至晉陽，與漢兵戰，漢大破之，追至于離石，復破之。

translations.literal: Xiong Nu depend left right Xian Wang lead ten thousand remain ride with Wang Huang wait garrison Guang Wu with south, reach Jin Yang, with Han troops battle, Han big break it, pursue reach Li Shi, again break it.
translations.idiomatic: The Xiongnu, relying on the Left and Right Wise Kings, led more than ten thousand cavalry along with Wang Huang and others to garrison south of Guangwu. They reached Jinyang and battled with Han troops. Han greatly defeated them, pursuing them to Lishi and defeating them again.

sentences.zh: 匈奴復聚兵樓煩西北，漢令車騎擊破匈奴。

translations.literal: Xiong Nu again gather troops Lou Fan north west, Han make che ride strike break Xiong Nu.
translations.idiomatic: The Xiongnu again gathered troops northwest of Loufan. Han ordered the chariot cavalry to attack and break the Xiongnu.

sentences.zh: 匈奴常敗走，漢乘勝追北，聞冒頓居代（上）谷，高皇帝居晉陽，使人視冒頓，還報曰「可擊」。

translations.literal: Xiong Nu constant defeat walk, Han ride victory pursue north, hear Mao Dun dwell Dai Gu, Gao Huang Di dwell Jin Yang, make person see Mao Dun, return report said 'able strike'.
translations.idiomatic: The Xiongnu constantly fled in defeat. Han, riding their victory, pursued northward. Hearing that Modun dwelt in Dai Valley, while the High Emperor dwelt in Jinyang, they sent someone to observe Modun. He returned and reported: 'We can attack.'

sentences.zh: 上遂至平城。

translations.literal: Shang then reach Ping Cheng.
translations.idiomatic: The emperor then reached Pingcheng.

sentences.zh: 上出白登，匈奴騎圍上，上乃使人厚遺閼氏。

translations.literal: Shang out Bai Deng, Xiong Nu ride surround shang, shang then make person thick yi Yan Zhi.
translations.idiomatic: The emperor went out to Baideng. Xiongnu cavalry surrounded him. The emperor then sent someone to generously bestow gifts on the Yanzhi.

sentences.zh: 閼氏乃說冒頓曰：「今得漢地，猶不能居；

translations.literal: Yan Zhi then say Mao Dun said: 'Now obtain Han land, still not able dwell;
translations.idiomatic: The Yanzhi then advised Modun: 'Even if we obtain Han lands now, we still cannot dwell in them;

sentences.zh: 且兩主不相緱」居七日，胡騎稍引去。

translations.literal: And two jun not each gou' dwell seven days, Hu ride gradually lead go.
translations.idiomatic: 'Moreover, two rulers do not kill each other.' After dwelling seven days, the Hu cavalry gradually withdrew.

sentences.zh: 時天大霧，漢使人往來，胡不覺。

translations.literal: Time heaven big fog, Han make person go come, Hu not aware.
translations.idiomatic: At the time there was heavy fog from heaven. Han envoys came and went, but the Hu were unaware.

sentences.zh: 護軍中尉陳平言上曰：「胡者全兵，請令彊弩傅兩矢外向，徐行出圍。」

translations.literal: Hu jun zhong wei Chen Ping speak shang said: 'Hu wait whole troops, please make strong nu fu two arrow outside toward, slow walk out surround.'
translations.idiomatic: The Protector General Zhongwei Chen Ping spoke to the emperor: 'The Hu have their full forces. Please order the strong crossbows with two arrows each to face outward, and slowly walk out of the encirclement.'

sentences.zh: 入平城，漢救兵亦到，胡騎遂解去。

translations.literal: Enter Ping Cheng, Han save troops also arrive, Hu ride then dissolve go.
translations.idiomatic: They entered Pingcheng. Han's rescue troops also arrived. The Hu cavalry then dispersed and left.

sentences.zh: 漢亦罷兵歸。

translations.literal: Han also stop troops return.
translations.idiomatic: Han also disbanded the troops and returned.

translations.literal: Han Xin become Xiong Nu jiang troops go come strike border.
translations.idiomatic: Han Xin served as a Xiongnu general, leading troops back and forth to attack the borders.

sentences.zh: 漢十年，信令王黃等說誤陳豨。

translations.literal: Han ten years, Xin make Wang Huang wait say mislead Chen Xi.
translations.idiomatic: In the tenth year of Han, Xin ordered Wang Huang and others to persuade and mislead Chen Xi.

sentences.zh: 十一年春，故韓王信復與胡騎入居參合，距漢。

translations.literal: Eleven years spring, former Han Wang Xin again with Hu ride enter dwell Can He, resist Han.
translations.idiomatic: In spring of the eleventh year, the former Han King Xin again entered and dwelt at Canhe with Hu cavalry, resisting Han.

sentences.zh: 漢使柴將軍擊之，遺信書曰：「陛下寬仁，諸侯雖有畔亡，而復歸，輒復故位號，不誅也。

translations.literal: Han make Chai jiang jun strike it, send Xin book said: 'Bi Xia kuan ren, various hou though have pan perish, yet again return, then again old position number, not execute.'
translations.idiomatic: Han sent General Chai to attack him, and sent Xin a letter saying: 'Your Majesty is magnanimous and benevolent. Though the various lords may rebel and flee, if they return, they immediately recover their former positions and titles, and are not executed.

sentences.zh: 大王所知。

translations.literal: Da Wang place know.
translations.idiomatic: As Your Majesty knows.

sentences.zh: 今王以敗亡走胡，非有大罪，急自歸！」

translations.literal: Now wang with defeat perish walk Hu, not have big crime, urgent self return!'
translations.idiomatic: Now that the king has fled to the Hu in defeat, it is not a great crime. Hurry and return!"

sentences.zh: 韓王信報曰：「陛下擢仆起閭巷，南面稱孤，此仆之幸也。

translations.literal: Han Wang Xin report said: 'Bi Xia pick pu rise li xiang, south face call gu, this pu lucky.'
translations.idiomatic: Han King Xin replied: 'Your Majesty raised me from the alleys and lanes. I face south and call myself lord. This is my good fortune.

sentences.zh: 滎陽之事，仆不能死，囚於項籍，此一罪也。

translations.literal: Xing Yang affairs, pu cannot die, prisoner at Xiang Ji, this one crime.
translations.idiomatic: In the matter of Xingyang, I could not die but was imprisoned by Xiang Ji. This is my first crime.

sentences.zh: 及寇攻馬邑，仆不能堅守，以城降之，此二罪也。

translations.literal: Reach bandit attack Ma Yi, pu cannot firm guard, with city descend it, this two crime.
translations.idiomatic: When bandits attacked Mayi, I could not hold it firmly and surrendered the city. This is my second crime.

sentences.zh: 今反為寇將兵，與將軍爭一旦之命，此三罪也。

translations.literal: Now rebel become bandit jiang troops, with jiang jun contend one morning life, this three crime.
translations.idiomatic: Now I have rebelled and become a bandit general, contending with the general for my life this morning. This is my third crime."

sentences.zh: 夫種、蠡無一罪，身死亡；

translations.literal: Fu Zhong, Li no one crime, body death perish;
translations.idiomatic: Fu Zhong and Li had no crime at all, yet they died.

sentences.zh: 今仆有三罪於陛下，而欲求活於世，此伍子胥所以僨於吳也。

translations.literal: Now pu have three crime at bi xia, yet desire seek live at world, this Wu Zi Xu so dun at Wu.
translations.idiomatic: Now I have three crimes against Your Majesty, yet I desire to seek life in the world. This is why Wu Zixu perished at Wu.

sentences.zh: 今仆亡匿山谷閒，旦暮乞貸蠻夷，仆之思歸，如痿人不忘起，盲者不忘視也，勢不可耳。」

translations.literal: Now pu perish hide mountain valley jian, dawn dusk beg lend Man Yi, pu think return, like cripple not forget rise, blind not forget see, power not able ear.'
translations.idiomatic: Now I hide in the mountain valleys, begging from the Man and Yi morning and night. My longing to return is like a lame man who does not forget to stand, a blind man who does not forget to see. But the situation makes it impossible.

sentences.zh: 遂戰。

translations.literal: Then battle.
translations.idiomatic: Thus they battled.

translations.idiomatic: General Chai slaughtered at Canhe and beheaded Han King Xin.

translations.literal: Xin enter Xiong Nu, with crown prince both;
translations.idiomatic: When Xin entered the Xiongnu, he was with the crown prince.

sentences.zh: 及至穨當城，生子，因名曰穨當。

translations.literal: Reach reach Peng Dang city, give birth son, because name said Peng Dang.
translations.idiomatic: When they reached Pengdang city, she gave birth to a son, and thus named him Pengdang.

sentences.zh: 韓太子亦生子，命曰嬰。

translations.literal: Han crown prince also give birth son, life said Ying.
translations.idiomatic: The Han crown prince also had a son, whom he named Ying.

sentences.zh: 至孝文十四年，穨當及嬰率其眾降漢。

translations.literal: Reach Xiao Wen fourteen years, Peng Dang and Ying lead their crowd descend Han.
translations.idiomatic: In the fourteenth year of Xiaowen, Pengdang and Ying led their followers and surrendered to Han.

sentences.zh: 漢封穨當為弓高侯，嬰為襄城侯。

translations.literal: Han seal Peng Dang become Gong Gao hou, Ying become Xiang Cheng hou.
translations.idiomatic: Han enfeoffed Pengdang as Marquis of Gonggao, and Ying as Marquis of Xiangcheng.

sentences.zh: 吳楚軍時，弓高侯功冠諸將。

translations.literal: Wu Chu army time, Gong Gao hou merit crown various jiang.
translations.idiomatic: During the Wu-Chu rebellion, the Marquis of Gonggao's merit surpassed all the generals.

sentences.zh: 傳子至孫，孫無子，失侯。

translations.literal: Transmit son reach grandson, grandson no son, lose hou.
translations.idiomatic: It was transmitted to his son and then to his grandson. The grandson had no sons, so the marquisate was lost.

sentences.zh: 嬰孫以不敬失侯。

translations.literal: Ying grandson with not respect lose hou.
translations.idiomatic: Ying's grandson lost the marquisate for lack of respect.

sentences.zh: 穨當孽孫韓嫣，貴幸，名富顯於當世。

translations.literal: Peng Dang bastard grandson Han Yan, noble fortunate, name rich manifest at dang world.
translations.idiomatic: Pengdang's illegitimate grandson Han Yan was noble and favored, his fame and wealth manifest in that era.

sentences.zh: 其弟說，再封，數稱將軍，卒為案道侯。

translations.idiomatic: When in the seventh month of Gaozus tenth year, the Supreme Emperor passed away, they sent someone to summon Xi, but Xi claimed he was very ill.

translations.idiomatic: When the emperor heard, he then pardoned the officials and people of Zhao and Dai who had been deceived and coerced into plundering by Xi.

sentences.zh: 上自往，至邯鄲，喜曰：「豨不南據漳水，北守邯鄲，知其無能為也。」

translations.idiomatic: The emperor went himself to Handan and happily said: Xi did not take the Zhang River to the south or guard Handan to the north. I know he is incapable of anything.

sentences.zh: 趙相奏斬常山守、尉，曰：「常山二十五城，豨反，亡其二十城。」

translations.literal: Zhao xiang memorial cut Chang Shan guard, wei, said: Chang Shan twenty five city, Xi rebel, perish its twenty city.
translations.idiomatic: The Chancellor of Zhao memorialized to execute the guards and commandants of Changshan, saying: Changshan has twenty-five cities. When Xi rebelled, twenty of them were lost.

sentences.zh: 上問曰：「守、尉反乎？」

translations.literal: Shang ask said: Guard, wei rebel?
translations.idiomatic: The emperor asked: Did the guards and commandants rebel?

sentences.zh: 對曰：「不反。」

translations.literal: Answer said: Not rebel.
translations.idiomatic: They answered: They did not rebel.

sentences.zh: 上曰：「是力不足也。」

translations.literal: Shang said: This strength not enough.
translations.idiomatic: The emperor said: This means their strength was insufficient.

sentences.zh: 赦之，復以為常山守、尉。

translations.literal: Pardon it, again become Chang Shan guard, wei.
translations.idiomatic: He pardoned them and again made them guards and commandants of Changshan.

sentences.zh: 上問周昌曰：「趙亦有壯士可令將者乎？」

translations.literal: Shang ask Zhou Chang said: Zhao also have strong shi able make lead?
translations.idiomatic: The emperor asked Zhou Chang: Does Zhao also have strong men who can be made generals?

sentences.zh: 對曰：「有四人。」

translations.literal: Answer said: Have four people.
translations.idiomatic: He answered: There are four men.

sentences.zh: 四人謁，上謾罵曰：「豎子能為將乎？」

translations.literal: Four people ye, shang man scold said: Shu zi able become jiang?
translations.idiomatic: The four men were presented. The emperor casually scolded them: You brats, can you become generals?

sentences.zh: 四人慚伏。

translations.literal: Four people shame prostrate.
translations.idiomatic: The four men were ashamed and prostrated themselves.

sentences.zh: 上封之各千戶，以為將。

translations.literal: Shang seal it each thousand hu, become jiang.
translations.idiomatic: The emperor enfeoffed each with a thousand households and made them generals.

sentences.zh: 左右諫曰：「從入蜀、漢，伐楚，功未遍行，今此何功而封？」

translations.literal: Left right advise said: Follow enter Shu, Han, attack Chu, merit not all line, now this what merit yet seal?
translations.idiomatic: His attendants advised: Those who followed into Shu and Han, attacked Chu—their merits have not all been rewarded. Now for what merit are these being enfeoffed?

sentences.zh: 上曰：「非若所知！

translations.literal: Shang said: Not if place know!
translations.idiomatic: The emperor said: This is not something you know!

sentences.zh: 陳豨反，邯鄲以北皆豨有，吾以羽檄徵天下兵，未有至者，今唯獨邯鄲中兵耳。

translations.idiomatic: Chen Xi rebelled. Everything north of Handan belonged to Xi. I issued urgent summons to raise troops from the world, but none arrived. Now only the troops in Handan itself remain.

translations.idiomatic: Why would I begrudge enfeoffing four men with four thousand households? It is to console the youths of Zhao!

sentences.zh: 皆曰：「善。」

translations.literal: All said: Good.
translations.idiomatic: All said: Good.

sentences.zh: 於是上曰：「陳豨將誰？」

translations.literal: Then shang said: Chen Xi lead who?
translations.idiomatic: Thereupon the emperor said: Who are Chen Xis generals?

sentences.zh: 曰：「王黃、曼丘臣，皆故賈人。」

translations.literal: Said: Wang Huang, Man Qiu Chen, all old Jia person.
translations.idiomatic: They said: Wang Huang and Manqiuchen, all former merchants.

sentences.zh: 上曰：「吾知之矣。」

translations.literal: Shang said: I know it.
translations.idiomatic: The emperor said: I know them.

sentences.zh: 乃各以千金購黃、臣等。

translations.literal: Then each with thousand jin purchase Huang, Chen wait.
translations.idiomatic: Thereupon he offered a thousand jin each to buy Huang, Chen, and the others.

sentences.zh: 十一年冬，漢兵擊斬陳豨將侯敞、王黃於曲逆下，破豨將張春於聊城，斬首萬餘。

translations.idiomatic: In winter of the eleventh year, Han troops attacked and beheaded Chen Xis generals Hou Chang and Wang Huang below Qu Ni, broke Xis general Zhang Chun at Liaocheng, and cut off more than ten thousand heads.

sentences.zh: 太尉勃入定太原、代地。

translations.literal: Tai wei Bo enter settle Tai Yuan, Dai land.
translations.idiomatic: Grand Commandant Bo entered and pacified Taiyuan and Dai territories.

sentences.zh: 十二月，上自擊東垣，東垣不下，卒罵上；

translations.literal: Twelve month, shang self strike Dong Yuan, Dong Yuan not descend, zu scold shang;
translations.idiomatic: In the twelfth month, the emperor personally attacked Dongyuan. Dongyuan did not surrender. The soldiers cursed the emperor.

translations.literal: Dong Yuan descend, zu scold cut it, not scold qing it.
translations.idiomatic: Dongyuan surrendered. Those soldiers who cursed were beheaded; those who did not curse were tattooed.

translations.idiomatic: He renamed Dongyuan Zhending.

translations.idiomatic: Wang Huang and Manqiuchens subordinates accepted the bounties offered for them and were all captured alive. For this reason, Chen Xis army was finally defeated.

translations.idiomatic: The emperor said: 'Dai is located north of Changshan. For Zhao to control it from south of the mountains would be too far.

translations.idiomatic: Thereupon he established his son Heng as King of Dai, with his capital at Zhongdu. Dai and Yanmen both belonged to Dai.

They took advantage of a moments power shift, succeeded through deceit and force, encountered the initial stabilization of Han, and thus obtained territories, facing south to call themselves lords.

sentences.zh: 內見疑彊大，外倚蠻貊以為援，是以日疏自危，事窮智困，卒赴匈奴，豈不哀哉！

When affairs reached an impasse and wisdom was exhausted, they finally fled to the Xiongnu. Is this not lamentable!
